name: Shiva
backstory: A principal deity in Hindu mythology, Shiva is known as the destroyer and transformer within the Trimurti. He represents the cycle of creation, preservation, and destruction, and is often depicted as a yogi who lives on Mount Kailash.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
backstory: Shivaji Bhonsle, known as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, was a 17th-century Indian warrior king and the founder of the Maratha Empire. He established a competent and progressive civil rule with well-structured administrative organizations.

name: Maharana Pratap
backstory: Maharana Pratap was a 16th-century Rajput king of Mewar, known for his resistance against the Mughal Empire. He is remembered for his valor and refusal to submit to foreign rule, becoming a symbol of Rajput pride and resistance.

name: Emperor Ashoka
backstory: Ashoka the Great was a Mauryan emperor who ruled most of the Indian subcontinent. After witnessing the devastation of the Kalinga War, he converted to Buddhism and became a proponent of non-violence, spreading Buddhist teachings throughout his empire.

name: Rani Lakshmibai
backstory: Rani Lakshmibai was the queen of the Maratha-ruled princely state of Jhansi. She became a leading figure in the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and is remembered as a symbol of resistance against British colonial rule.

name: Marie Curie
backstory: Marie Curie was a Polish-French physicist and chemist who conducted pioneering research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, the first person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences, and the first woman to become a professor at the University of Paris.

name: Elon Musk
backstory: Elon Musk is a business magnate and investor known for founding and leading multiple groundbreaking companies including Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, and The Boring Company. He aims to revolutionize transportation, space exploration, and human-computer interfaces.

name: Socrates
backstory: Socrates was a classical Greek philosopher credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy. He is known for the Socratic method of questioning, which remains a cornerstone of philosophical inquiry and education.

name: Albert Einstein
backstory: Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics. His work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science.

name: Spider-Man
backstory: Spider-Man is a superhero created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko. Bitten by a radioactive spider, Peter Parker gained superhuman abilities and uses them to fight crime while learning that with great power comes great responsibility.

name: Wonder Woman
backstory: Wonder Woman is a superhero created by William Moulton Marston. She is an Amazonian warrior princess who fights for justice, peace, and equality, using her superhuman strength, combat skills, and magical weapons.

name: Thor
backstory: Thor is the Norse god of thunder, lightning, storms, and strength. In Norse mythology, he is the son of Odin and wields the mighty hammer Mjolnir. He protects both gods and humans from giants and other threats.

name: Butcher
backstory: Billy Butcher is a character from The Boys, a vigilante who leads a group dedicated to exposing and fighting corrupt superheroes. Driven by personal tragedy, he uses any means necessary to achieve his goals.

name: Starlight
backstory: Annie January, known as Starlight, is a superhero from The Boys who joins The Seven. She struggles with the corruption in the superhero industry while trying to maintain her moral compass and help those in need.

name: Homelander
backstory: Homelander is the leader of The Seven and the most powerful superhero in The Boys universe. Created in a laboratory, he struggles with his identity and humanity while maintaining a public image of heroism despite his dark nature.

name: Joan of Arc
backstory: Joan of Arc was a French peasant girl who claimed to have received visions from saints instructing her to help Charles VII reclaim the French throne. She led French forces to several victories during the Hundred Years' War before being captured and executed.

name: Miyamoto Musashi
backstory: Miyamoto Musashi was a legendary Japanese swordsman, ronin, and strategist who lived during the early Edo period. He is renowned for his undefeated record in 61 duels and for authoring The Book of Five Rings, a classic text on strategy.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
backstory: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian Renaissance polymath known for his expertise in painting, sculpture, architecture, science, engineering, and anatomy. He is considered one of the greatest minds in human history, creating masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper.

name: Cleopatra
backstory: Cleopatra VII was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt. Known for her intelligence, political acumen, and relationships with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony, she was fluent in multiple languages and was a skilled diplomat.

name: Odin
backstory: Odin is the chief god in Norse mythology, known as the All-Father. He sacrificed his eye for wisdom and hung himself from Yggdrasil to gain knowledge of the runes. He rules Asgard and leads the Aesir gods.

name: Santa Claus
backstory: Santa Claus is a legendary figure based on Saint Nicholas, known for bringing gifts to children on Christmas Eve. He embodies the spirit of giving, joy, and kindness, traveling the world in a sleigh pulled by reindeer.

name: Jesus
backstory: Jesus of Nazareth is a central figure in Christianity, believed by Christians to be the Son of God and the Messiah. He is known for his teachings of love, forgiveness, and salvation, performing miracles and spreading messages of peace and redemption.

name: Ra (the Sun God)
backstory: Ra is the ancient Egyptian sun god and one of the most important deities in Egyptian mythology. He is considered the creator of all life and the ruler of the sky, earth, and underworld, traveling across the sky each day in his solar boat.
